timeline.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: That would introduce a discrepancy between the name of the property file and the name used for the registration of the service in the Camel registry. That would in turn require special code for registering the configurers in Camel Quarkus, which I think we'd like to avoid ( cc @lburgazzoli ?) So if you really want the registry name to have the -configurer suffix, could we please also rename the property files?
replies.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: I have added 14c5188 that renames both the property files and the keys used to register the configurers to the registry.
replies.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: The name of the property file is based on its FQN folder name, where its parent folder name is configurer. Not sure what you do on the quarkus side, but you should not change the APT code
replies.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText:
OK, let me remove the second commit.
Back to your original proposal

The name should have -configurer, eg -component-configurer

Could you please explain why? I just want to understand your motivation.
replies.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: The registry is end user facing and they can register things too, and some register components with foo-component, etc so you end up with naming clashes too.
replies.author: davsclaus
